title: Can Python read Excel files? - Quora

response.answer_text: Interacting with Microsoft Excel files is different compared to reading and/or writing MS Excel files. The former implies that your Python script can actively interact live with your Python script. This means that data from the Python script can be sent to Excel and the script can read data entered into the Excel file live (after the script begins running). The latter means that your Python script can read existing Excel files or write new Excel files (or modified version of Excel file previously read). The former can be done using Python package xlwings (and perhaps others that I may not know of) while the latter can be done using a host of packages such as xlrd, xlwt, pandas etc.

Yes, Reading, Manupulating and Writing files is the neccessity of python. For reading Excel files in Python you have to use well known Pandas Module. Install Pandas (if haven’t installed) by running below code in Command Prompt - pip install pandas Syntax for reading Excel file in Pandas use following code - # Importing the Pandas module import pandas as pd  # Reading and storing the data in "df" df = pd.read_excel('path\to\your\excle file.xlsx')  # Printing/Displaying the stored data print(df) For detailed explanation about it you can refer this video. If you find this helpful then, should consider upvoting :)
